p: Fungi are significant spoilage microorganism of foodstuffs during the storage, rendering them unfit for human consumption by retarding the quality of food. These fungi may produce as secondary metabolites a diverse group of chemical substances known as mycotoxins. Aflatoxins are the most hazardous mycotoxins that contaminate foods. They are produced by fungi such as Aspergillus flavus and Aspergillus parasiticus ( A. flavus belonged to Aspergillus family). The favorable humidity and temperature for its activity are 80–90% and 36–38°C, respectively (Benavides, Villalobos‐Carvajal, & Reyes, 2012; Kamkar, Karim, Aliabadi, & Khaksar, 2008; Nazzaro, Fratianni, De Martino, Coppola, & De Feo, 2013).
